chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Clay N Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive with any other sentence, with Huber release privileges for Huber, treatment and the Day Reporting Center, with credit for 48 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution set at $0.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job.
Obtain GED or HSED.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Defendant to be supervised in the Mental Health Unit of Probation/Parole.
Cooperate with agent.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: Court STAYED sentence to be used at the discretion of the agent.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 68 days time served.  Court ordered costs and surcharges WAIVED as defendant is indigent and this will cause a significant financial burden on the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clay N Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Clay N Johnson
Current: General Delivery, Appleton, WI 54911-9999 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2016)
Prior: 4360 North 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $1162.50 to Dr. Luzi  for services on 05/11, 05/23, 05/26 of 2015
Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information.  Defense waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty

Defendant Clay N Johnson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Clay N Johnson in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charge and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive with any other sentence, with Huber release privileges for Huber, treatment and the Day Reporting Center, with credit for 48 days time served.   Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of  2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to be supervised in the Mental Health Unit of Probation/Parole 
-As a condition of probation, defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Corrections.  Court STAYED sentence to be used at the discretion of the agent.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced defendant to a term of 68 days in the House of Corrections, with credit for 68 days time served.  Court ordered costs and surcharges WAIVED as defendant is indigent and this will cause a significant financial burden on the defendant.  

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Clay N Johnson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Clay N Johnson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties do not contest the findings of Dr. Luzi.  Defendant withdraws his special plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.
Order for Examination under Wisc. Stat. 971.16, signed and filed.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Clay N Johnson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of today's proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court Wisconsin Forensice Unit to examine the defendant for NGI pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.16.  Hearing date selected with the parties.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
TOT Justice Point CONTINUED.  SAME BAIL TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Clay N Johnson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail/bond hearing.  Hearing proceeded.
Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  
The Court modifies(lowers) bail to $300.00 CASH with same terms.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued, however Commissioner not inclined to modify bail set by a Judge.

Defendant Clay N Johnson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Clay N Johnson in custody.  Deann Heard for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint, defense waives reading.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER HAS BEEN APPOINTED.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.

Defendant Clay N Johnson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Clay N Johnson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Parties in receipt of report dated 3-10-15 authored by Dr. John Pankiewicz finding the defendant competent to stand trial.   There being no challenge to the report by the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Clay N Johnson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Doctor's Report Return.  Parties advised that Branch 21 is in jury trial and unable to hear this matter on today; spin court unavailable.  Adjourned date selected with counsel.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report dated 3-10-15 authored by John Pankiewicz, M.D., received and filed.

Defendant Clay N Johnson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Clay N Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Clay N Johnson not in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/16/15 @ 1 PM
